description: Creates a delivery. A delivery is a connection between a logical delivery source and a logical delivery destination that you have already created. Only some Amazon Web Services services support being configured as a delivery source using this operation. These services are listed as Supported [V2 Permissions] in the table at Enabling logging from Amazon Web Services services. A delivery destination can represent a log group in CloudWatch Logs, an Amazon S3 bucket, or a delivery stream in Firehose. To configure logs delivery between a supported Amazon Web Services service and a destination, you must do the following: You can configure a single delivery source to send logs to multiple destinations by creating multiple deliveries. You can also create multiple deliveries to configure multiple delivery sources to send logs to the same delivery destination. To update an existing delivery configuration, use UpdateDeliveryConfiguration.

parameters.name: deliverySourceName
parameters.description: The name of the delivery source to use for this delivery.

parameters.name: deliveryDestinationArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the delivery destination to use for this delivery.

parameters.name: recordFields
parameters.description: The list of record fields to be delivered to the destination, in order. If the delivery's log source has mandatory fields, they must be included in this list. (string) ---

parameters.name: s3DeliveryConfiguration
parameters.description: This structure contains parameters that are valid only when the delivery's delivery destination is an S3 bucket. suffixPath (string) --- This string allows re-configuring the S3 object prefix to contain either static or variable sections. The valid variables to use in the suffix path will vary by each log source. To find the values supported for the suffix path for each log source, use the DescribeConfigurationTemplates operation and check the allowedSuffixPathFields field in the response. enableHiveCompatiblePath (boolean) --- This parameter causes the S3 objects that contain delivered logs to use a prefix structure that allows for integration with Apache Hive.

nested_params.name: suffixPath
nested_params.description: This string allows re-configuring the S3 object prefix to contain either static or variable sections. The valid variables to use in the suffix path will vary by each log source. To find the values supported for the suffix path for each log source, use the DescribeConfigurationTemplates operation and check the allowedSuffixPathFields field in the response.

nested_params.name: enableHiveCompatiblePath
nested_params.description: This parameter causes the S3 objects that contain delivered logs to use a prefix structure that allows for integration with Apache Hive.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: An optional list of key-value pairs to associate with the resource. For more information about tagging, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique ID that identifies this delivery in your account.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies this delivery.

nested_items.name: deliverySourceName
nested_items.description: The name of the delivery source that is associated with this delivery.

nested_items.name: deliveryDestinationArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the delivery destination that is associated with this delivery.

nested_items.name: deliveryDestinationType
nested_items.description: Displays whether the delivery destination associated with this delivery is CloudWatch Logs, Amazon S3, or Firehose.

nested_items.name: recordFields
nested_items.description: The record fields used in this delivery.

nested_items.name: fieldDelimiter
nested_items.description: The field delimiter that is used between record fields when the final output format of a delivery is in Plain, W3C, or Raw format.

nested_items.name: s3DeliveryConfiguration
nested_items.description: This structure contains delivery configurations that apply only when the delivery destination resource is an S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: suffixPath
nested_items.description: This string allows re-configuring the S3 object prefix to contain either static or variable sections. The valid variables to use in the suffix path will vary by each log source. To find the values supported for the suffix path for each log source, use the DescribeConfigurationTemplates operation and check the allowedSuffixPathFields field in the response.

nested_items.name: enableHiveCompatiblePath
nested_items.description: This parameter causes the S3 objects that contain delivered logs to use a prefix structure that allows for integration with Apache Hive.
